class.name: jsx3.gui.Table
class.text:
A lightweight control that displays CDF data in an HTML table. Supports both single- and multi-selection modes. Data can be sorted by clicking on column labels. Output and output formatting can be customized using a combination of XSLT, inline CSS properties, or named CSS rules. The columns for this control are defined within the object model and are not defined in the DOM as child objects.
The Table class by default supports the following CDF attributes:
jsxid
jsxselected
jsxstyle
jsxclass
jsximg
jsxtip
jsxunselectable
jsxexecute
This class publishes the following model events:
EXECUTE –
MENU –
CHANGE –
SPYGLASS –

param.name: strName
param.text: unique name distinguishing this object from all other JSX GUI objects in the JSX application

field.name: DEFAULT_CELL_VALUE_TEMPLATE
field.text: Default XSL template for rendering the cell value for all cells. This template can be replaced with a custom XSL template. The template should match on a record element (match="record") and will be used for all data cells in the body of the table. This template will be passed one named parameter (xsl:param) named attname, the name of the attribute to which the column is mapped.

field.name: SELECTION_MULTI_ROW
field.text: Enum value for the multiSelect property indicating a single-select table.

field.name: SELECTION_ROW
field.text: Enum value for the multiSelect property indicating a multi-select table.

field.name: SELECTION_UNSELECTABLE
field.text: Enum value for the multiSelect property indicating an unselectable table.

method.name: deselectAllRecords
method.text: Deselects all selected CDF records.

method.name: deselectRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the record to deselect.

method.text: Deselects a CDF record within the Table. Both the view and the data model (CDF) will be updated

method.name: doSort

param.name: intSortDir
param.text: jsx3.gui.Table.SORT_ASCENDING or jsx3.gui.Table.SORT_DESCENDING.

method.text: Sorts according to the current sort path. If no sort direction is specified, the sort direction will be toggled.

method.name: doValidate
method.text: validates the Table; if the Table is set to 'required', a selection must be made to pass validation. Otherwise, a Table will always pass validation

method.name: focusRowById

param.name: strCdfId
param.text: jsxid property for the corresponding CDF record

method.text: Applies focus to the on-screen row indentified by the CDF record id that generated it

method.name: getAlternateRowClass
method.text: Returns the CSS rule for the HTML row element(s) containing the alternating table data rows.

method.name: getAlternateRowStyle
method.text: Returns the CSS properties for the HTML row element(s) containing the alternating table data rows.

method.name: getCanSort
method.text: Returns whether the table is sortable. If null or jsx3.Boolean.TRUE, the instance is sortable.

method.name: getCellClass
method.text: Returns the CSS rule that will be applied to every HTML cell in the body of the table.

method.name: getCellStyle
method.text: Returns the CSS properties that will be inlined on every HTML cell in the body of the table.

method.name: getColumnProfile
method.text: Returns the string of XML in CDF format representing the Column Profile Document.

method.name: getColumnProfileDocument
method.text: Returns a clone of the CDF document used internally to define the Columns (text, order, mapped attributes, etc). The order of the records in this document reflects the order of the columns in the Table. If the column profile document defined by getColumnProfile is not a valid XML document, an empty CDF Document will be returned instead. Note that if you make changes to the Document returned by this method, those changes will only be reflected by calling setColumnProfile (to update the model), followed by a call to repaint (to update the view).

method.name: getContentElement

param.name: strCdfId
param.text: jsxid property for CDF record

param.name: strAttName
param.text: attribute name on the CDF record. For example, jsxtext

method.text: Returns the on-screen cell that represents the intersection of the row identified by strCdfId and the first cell mapped to the named CDF attribute, strAttName.

method.name: getHeaderClass
method.text: Returns the CSS rule for the HTML row containing the column headers.

method.name: getHeaderHeight

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the height of the header row in pixels. If this value is not set (null), the list will render with the default value of jsx3.gui.Table.DEFAULT_HEADER_HEIGHT.

method.name: getHeaderStyle
method.text: Returns the CSS style for the HTML row containing the column headers.

method.name: getNoDataMessage
method.text: Returns the text/HTML to display on-screen when the xml/xsl transformation for this object results in a null or empty result set

method.name: getRenderingContext

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the jsxid of the CDF record that will serve as the origin when rendering the data on-screen. If not set, the id, jsxroot, (which is the id for the root node, <data>) will be used.

method.name: getRowClass
method.text: Returns the CSS rule for the HTML row element(s) containing the table data.

method.name: getRowStyle
method.text: Returns the CSS properties for the HTML row elements(s) containing the table data.

method.name: getSelectedIds
method.text: Returns the jsxid(s) for the selected record(s). Equivalent to this.getValue() except that the return value is always an Array.

method.name: getSelectedNodes
method.text: Returns the collection of selected records.

method.name: getSelectionBG

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null (Table.SELECTION_BG)

method.text: Returns the CSS string to apply to a Row/Cell when it has focus

method.name: getSelectionModel

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the selection model. If no selection type is specified, the instance will employ single row selection (SELECTION_ROW)

method.name: getSortDirection
method.text: Returns the direction (jsx3.gui.Table.SORT_ASCENDING or jsx3.gui.Table.SORT_DESCENDING) for the sorted column; if no direction specified, ascending is returned

method.name: getSortPath
method.text: Returns the name of the CDF attribute to sort on. If no value is set an empty string is returned by default.

method.name: getSortType
method.text: Returns the data type to be used for sorting this list.

method.name: getValue
method.text: Returns an array of selected values (or empty array) if the selection model is Table.SELECTION_MULTI_ROW. Returns a string (or null) for the other selection models

method.name: getValueTemplate
method.text: Gets the user-defined XSL template (xsl:template) that will override the defualt template defined by Table.DEFAULT_CELL_VALUE_TEMPLATE.

method.name: getWrap
method.text: Returns whether or not the table's data cells support text-wrapping and expand vertically to display their wrapped content. If this property is not set, the cell content will not wrap.

method.name: getXSL

return.text: jsx3.xml.Document instance containing valid XSL stylesheet

method.text: Returns XSLT for the Table, prioritizing the acquisition in the following order: 1) check cache; 2) check jsxxsl; 3) check jsxxslurl; 4) use default

method.name: paint
method.text: Returns the DHTML, used for this object's on-screen VIEW

method.name: redrawRecord
method.text: This method implements redraw support by repainting the entire control.

method.name: repaintData
method.text: Paints only the data rows. Call for quick repainting of the data rows when only the source data has changed. Does not recalculate and reprofile the box profile and resulting XSLT. Retains scroll position when possible.

method.name: repaintHead
method.text: Paints only the header row. Call for quick repainting of the header row and not the data rows.

method.name: selectRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the record to select.

method.text: Selects a CDF record of this list. The item will be highlighted in the view and the CDF data will be updated accordingly. If this list is a multi-select list then this selection will be added to any previous selection.

method.name: setAlternateRowClass
method.text: Sets the CSS rule for the HTML row element(s) containing the alternating table data rows. Multiple rules are supported. For example: bodyText, normalText.

method.name: setAlternateRowStyle
method.text: Sets the CSS properties for the HTML row element(s) containing the alternating table data rows. Multiple properties are supported. For example: background-color:red;font-family:Arial;.

method.name: setCanSort

param.name: SORT
param.text: one of jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether the table is sortable.

method.name: setCellClass
method.text: Sets the CSS rule that will be applied to every HTML cell in the body of the table. Multiple rules are supported. For example: boldText titleText.

method.name: setCellStyle
method.text: Sets the CSS properties that will be inlined on every HTML cell in the body of the table. Multiple properties are supported. For example: text-align:right;background-color:#eeeeee;border-bottom:solid 1px #aeaeae;.

method.name: setColumnProfile
method.text:
Sets a string of XML (in CDF format) or an actual jsx3.xml.CDF.Document instance representing the Column Profile Document. Each record in this document defines the profile for a column in the Table. The following attributes are supported on each record:
jsxid: The unique ID for the record (REQUIRED).
jsxtext: HTML or text content to use as the column label.
jsxwidth: The width of the column (pixel units are implied). For example: 300, or 25%.
jsxpath: The name of the attribute to which this column maps (REQUIRED).
jsxpathtype: The data type for the attribute. One of: text (default) or number.
For example:
<data jsxid="jsxroot"> <record jsxid="a1" jsxtext="<b>Column 1</b>" jsxpath="jsxtext"/> <record jsxid="a2" jsxtext="Column 2" jsxwidth="100" jsxpath="value" jsxpathtype="number"/> </data>

method.name: setHeaderClass
method.text: Sets the CSS rule for the HTML row containing the column headers. Multiple rules are supported. For example: boldText titleText. The following CSS properties (those affecting layout and position) are not allowed for the rule: width, height, left, top, position, overflow, border, padding, margin.

method.name: setHeaderHeight

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring. Typically property updates that affect the browser-specific box model (such as height) are repainted immediately to keep the box model abstraction in sync with the native view. However, the repaint can be suppressed to avoid unnecessary reparsing of the XSLT during repeated property updates.

method.text: Sets the height of the header row in pixels. Set to zero (0) to hide the header row and only render the body rows.

method.name: setHeaderStyle
method.text: Sets the CSS style properties for the HTML row containing the column headers. Multiple properties are supported. For example: background-image:url(JSXAPPS/myproject/images/bg.gif);font-family:Arial;. The following CSS properties (those affecting layout and position) are not allowed: width, height, left, top, position, overflow, border, padding, margin.

method.name: setRenderingContext

param.name: strJsxId
param.text: jsxid property for the CDF record to use as the contextual root when rendering data on-screen.

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring.

method.text: Sets the jsxid of the CDF record that will serve as the origin when rendering the data on-screen.

method.name: setRowClass
method.text: Sets the CSS rule for the HTML row element(s) containing the table data. Every row will apply the rule defined by this value, unless an alternate row rule is used, in which case, the rule (classname) is alternated between this value and the value applied by setAlternateRowClass. Multiple rules are supported. For example: bodyText normalText.

method.name: setRowStyle
method.text: Sets the CSS properties for the HTML row element(s) containing the table data. Every row will apply the properties defined by this value, unless an alternate row style is used, in which case, the properties are alternated between this value and the value applied by setAlternateRowStyle. Multiple properties are supported. For example: background-color:white;font-family:Arial;.

method.name: setSelectionBG
method.text: Sets the URL for the image to use (as the repeating background image) to denote selection.

method.name: setSelectionModel

param.name: intType
param.text: one of Table: .SELECTION_UNSELECTABLE, .SELECTION_ROW, .SELECTION_MULTI_ROW

method.text: Sets the selection model

method.name: setSortDirection

param.name: intSortDir
param.text: one of: jsx3.gui.Table.SORT_ASCENDING or jsx3.gui.Table.SORT_DESCENDING

method.text: Sets the direction (ascending or descending) for the sorted column.

method.name: setSortPath
method.text: Sets the name of the CDF attribute to sort on. The records in the data source of this table are sorted on this attribute before being painted to screen.

method.name: setSortType

param.name: DATATYPE
param.text: data type for this column's data. Valid types include: jsx3.gui.Table.TYPE_TEXT and jsx3.gui.Table.TYPE_NUMBER

method.text: Sets the data type for the list.

method.name: setValue

param.name: strId
param.text: jsxid attribute for the CDF record(s) to select

method.text: Sets the value of this table. Deselects all existing selections. Scrolls the first record into view.

method.name: setValueTemplate

param.name: TEMPLATE
param.text: valid xsl:template

method.text: Sets the user-defined XSL template that will override the defualt template defined by Table.DEFAULT_CELL_VALUE_TEMPLATE. The template must resolve to a valid XSL Template when parsed. The template should match on a record (match="record"). The template will be passed a single XSL param (xsl:param) named attname.

method.name: setWrap

param.name: WRAP
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether or not the table's data cells support text-wrapping and expand vertically to display their wrapped content.
